TopicTitle: Reputation score dropped for seemingly no reason

Articles.Content:
Not sure what happened. Only thing I did different that I can think of is crashing an unmanned cockpit. Only reason I am doubting my unmanned cockpit theory is that I noticed it on my second launch attempt trying to test the same cockpit and it did not change rep after crashing that one.

After I noticed I did go back to check; I don't have any lost Kerbals, I haven't failed any contracts, and I haven't damaged any buildings. I also was not missing any money, at least not that I could tell. I do have both penalties set to x10 (I'm guessing this is how I noticed).

I also know that this could be near impossible to track due to the excessive number of mods I have, so this is more of a question of if anyone knows any certain parts or unexpected situations that could possibly have caused this...

I am having the same issue. I am playing my career on a private DMP-Server though with a friend at normal mode. We both lose reputation constantly, even though we don't lose any kerbals or crash any buildings etc.

It would be nice to know what might cause sudden drops in reputation. I was down to -354 very fast (I only researched a few nodes). E.g. does debris that falls near the KSC (not onto any building, just near the center in general) cause a drop?
I also play dmp, my reputation get -800 after several launch. Pretty annoying, No kerbal get loss, no building crash
Not sure if this is your issue, but you loose rep for declining missions now. You need to change it in custom options.
